website_summaries.verdict: It may not hold up as well as metal models, but this ergonomically-designed plastic scoop is a favorite among dog owners with joint problems.
pros: Ergonomilcally designed handle with cushy finger pad
Jaw springs calibrated to keep tool working well
Choice of edges designed for specific surfaces
cons: Plastic construction means this tool may not be as durable as other options

customer_reviews.title: The future
customer_reviews.text: I was sitting on my couch looking at the mess my Puppy had made while my girlfriend had been out of town. Then the door bell rings and I look out to see a package by the door. so I go out, pickup the package (a long brown amazon box), and take it inside. Once I open it I find the pooper scooper and decided to test it. It’s the best thing ever, it can do it all.
customer_reviews.author: Leeee

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly breakable
customer_reviews.text: My new worst product ever purchased on Amazon! I often buy things with bad reviews and get away with it, and for this price I couldn't reisist. However, I unboxed this product, walked into my yard, picked up one pile of dog poop, and the jaws cracked and no longer shut. I did not even manage to get one pile of poop from the ground to the garbage bag. My confidence in products has forever been shaken lol. In all seriousness, it was waste of money. Not a big one, thankfully, but if you ever need to 100% rely on a poop scoop you're gonna have to spend a but more, this thing couldn't handle it
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Gafford

customer_reviews.title: So far so good 🐾
customer_reviews.text: This is a good scoop. It has the right amount of tension to pick up my dogs bombs with ease. The handle is comfortable and easy and I can use it with one hand. (I think a kid or an elderly may need 2 hands to open it) It's long but you still do have to bend unless your 4 ft tall. The thing about these scoopers is that metal springs rust and eventually break, especially when left out in the weather. But I do plan on leaving this outside because who wants a poopy claw in the house! If I get a year out of this I will be happy. I'll update this when it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle H

customer_reviews.title: It does what it's supposed to and pretty well actually
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to and pretty well actually. We have 3 dogs and this makes quick work of our large yard. It has held up well since we purchased it and I don't see any weak spots after a large number of uses. We leave it outside hung to the side of a shed. It show no signs of wear from southern US tempatures and storms.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Goforth

customer_reviews.title: of the poop scoops available on amazon, this is THE best value
customer_reviews.text: the Dogit Jawz is not collapsable, which means it doesnt have a built in failure point. collapsable poop scoops are only collapsable to make convenient to ship, after that they are a detriment. Dogit Jawz has heavy duty springs for a firm grip on the poops while the teeth on one jaw and tapered flat opposing jaw make grass, sand, and rock poop cleaning almost enjoyable. i can't believe this poop scooper was only $5.65. seriously this is a really good poop scooper and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: ken f.

customer_reviews.title: Poop trex
customer_reviews.text: Love this bad boy. Compared pricing and quality to a pet department store and it just doesn’t compare. This is a much better deal and it gets delivered to the door so you don’t have to do the walk of shame to your car with it. This is a very sturdy device and keeps the stank away from you. Also, it turns a chore into a game. It’s like a trex chancing down unexpected poop piles. It’s super satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great for short to average height and usable for the disabled too!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Easy to use and not too much bending required, product is tall enough for those at 4'-5' 8" can use it well. For those disabled like myself it is easy to squeeze the handle to pick things up, I still have bad days my arthritis and other ailments wont let me even grasp one sheet of paper so I cant use this then but its the best one I have found and used over the last year or so. Quality is good, will hold together well and for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I had an old shovel and pail type of pooper scooper that I was using before, but was really more interested in having one of this style. This is so much easier! No more scraping or leaving over. It has a lot of tension so it picks up pretty well. My backyard is a bit uneven and has some holes in some spots, so it’s a little difficult to pick up a turd that’s fallen in a hole or uneven part, but I manage! I’m happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: The claws in this work WONDERFUL in grass as it seperates the dog poop from ...
customer_reviews.text: Other ones we purchased were thin plastic. This one is heavy thick plastic! The claws in this work WONDERFUL in grass as it seperates the dog poop from the grass VERY WELL. The handle and pull are built very sturdy and seems like this will last forever. Plus, we live in snow area and it has gotten below freezing and this plastic did not crack or chip like other scoopers. Would buy again if this breaks, but I dont think this one will break in a very very long time. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Deb S.

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: More than what I espect, I've paid up to 50 to 60 dollars for one idintical to this but not as 6 good quality. The grip is good and strong but yet easy to use, easy clean up, slide a plastic bag over it or dog potty bag and really keep it clean. I use this to pick up garbage to I'm older and can't bend down easy. This baby is the one to get. Quality is great it's not that cheap flimsy plastic it's a durable plastic, it's more than espect. I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: EsteeDarla

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 2 months. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: The hinge broke apart after 2 months of occasional use and the product is now unusable. This is a very cheaply made product compared to my previous scooper which lasted for 3 years. Without being too graphic, it’s nearly impossible to pick up after your dog unless his poop is hard and solid. Forgot about using this scooper to pick up your dog’s waste after it’s been rained on. And this scooper does not function well when picking up in grassy areas. This purchase was a complete waste on money.
customer_reviews.author: JennyWren

customer_reviews.title: Does its job- just hard to clean the aftermath!!
customer_reviews.text: This definitely does the trick and it is much better than the alternative! Having said that, it tends to be a little wobbly... But, where This falls short- is trying to get the poop out of the cracks and crevices!! The benefit is knowing that no hands have to touch the nastiness and yet, I don’t want to touch it during cleaning either! I’m not sure the solution? Maybe a cover over the metal hinges?? Basically.. where the hinge comes together when poop makes its way into those cracks, I really don’t like it! And it has to be cleaned out or it’s NASTY!!
customer_reviews.author: The Girl Utah

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cheap cheap - Don't order
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. This is cheap plastic and it broke after a few weeks of light use for one small dog. We used this to scoop a couple of times a week. Even cheap plastic should last longer than this. If I hadn't forgotten to send it back during the allowable window it would have been returned. Don't waste your money. Find a better product. I'll be looking for something that will last longer, even if it cost a few dollars more. I certainly don't want another cheap piece of junk like this one.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: fingers crossed
customer_reviews.text: The first one arrived broken. I attributed it to the Amazon Warehouse, but I usually get great deals there. This one is perfect, and I noticed a number of bad reviews claiming easy breakage. Let's hope this is a good one otherwise I'll be buying from the pet store where I can try it first. The springs are surprisingly strong, and perhaps the jaws could open wider, but for now it's #1 in the #2 business.
customer_reviews.author: Allen S

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've always lived in the country and my dogs always just went in the horse pasture, so I never had to pick up poop before I moved into a neighborhood. Thankfully, I don't have to grab it with a bag or put on gloves or anything like that anymore. I just throw a kitchen trash bag in a 5 gallon bucket and walk around the yard with this thing. I didn't think it was going to have a strong enough "closing spring" to grab it all, but it does! Hasn't failed me yet!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Zampedri

customer_reviews.title: Not for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: This would be great for bigger breeds from about medium size and up. But for smaller dogs like chihuahuas, terriers, etc it doesn't really pick up crap. Being smaller loads specially on rocks, not worth it. Wish we would have returned it before time was up. A rack and dust pan made for dog stools would work a lot better and easier. On grass probably works better. But rocks and cement for small dogs it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Michael g.

customer_reviews.title: Great for frequent dumps
customer_reviews.text: I have a Shih Tzu and a German Rottweiler puppy and let me tell you, the Rotts turds are larger and more frequent than the Tzu and he's only 8 weeks old. Trying to potty train him to use the bathroom ONLY outside and boy does he let 'er rip. This thing picks up turds and a nice chunk of our backyard grass with it. I don't care; not trying to get Rottie dung clumped on the teeth of this thing, ew. Would rather destroy my grass 😂 5/5 ❤️
customer_reviews.author: catdog

customer_reviews.title: We like it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one and the other kind that's the little trash can on a handle and a little rake on a handle, at the same time, hoping to entice my teenagers to do their chores with better tools. This one is the go-to for the cleanup job over the other design, time and time again. I like it because I can use it with one hand. Feels strong and sturdy, does a great job on both grass and pea gravel. I store it out of the sun and weather to help the plastic last longer. No cons, great price and delivered lightning fast to my doorstep = perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mel C

customer_reviews.title: It is what it's meant to pick up....POOP
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE... PEICE OF GARBAGE ALREADY BROKE!! DONT BUY IT! ZERO STARS!! CHEAP PLASTIC!! I bought the "grass" model and if it's meant to not take grass along with the Poo, it's not doing a good job at that. Also, doesn't release the Poo as cleanly as my old one. Kinda getting stuck to the plastic. May have to search for a new one because if I keep using this one, I won't have grass by spring...
customer_reviews.author: mark beebe

customer_reviews.title: Better design than my other scooper
customer_reviews.text: This product has large teeth on one side and more of a flat edge( with indentations for the teeth ) on the other side. When I first saw this design I didn’t think it would work near as well as my previous scoopers which had equal size teeth on both sides. However, it is a far superior design, much better to use than my other products. Grass will,easily pull through the scooper and leave the poop in it. I have a shih tzu but it is fine for larger dogs. No well dressed man should be without one
customer_reviews.author: The matador

customer_reviews.title: Makes walking the dogs easier
customer_reviews.text: It has excellent grip. I use a trash bag with mine for easy clean up. I have two dogs, if one goes , then the other I am still able to grab both the scooper as the ability to hold what you already picked up. When im done, i pull my back down tie with a bow. Makes walking my dogs great. It beats carrying a bag and smelling it. With the scooper its far from me :)
customer_reviews.author: LookingForAdealAlways

customer_reviews.title: Not the best I've used
customer_reviews.text: It seems like it's made from good quality plastic. However, the handle is very tough to squeeze which makes it very hard to operate and pick up the "presents" my dogs leave behind. I used if for most of the summer thinking I could break the handle in to make it a little easier to squeeze, however, it didn't get any better. I can't imagine someone trying to use this if they have arthritis or any other impairment that could affect their grip strength. I figured I'd try it out, but I think I'll just stick with my shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: So I have two dogs. My one is very small and her droppings are very small like the size of a tootsie roll and sometimes it had difficulty grabbing those ones but my other dog is small/medium size and it had no problem grabbing his droppings. I should have realized this when I bought it but if you arnt picking the piles one at a time then you have to drop everything in your scoop and scoop it back up again. Which doesn’t sound like a big deal and it’s not, it’s just a little annoying. Super easy to use. I definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Garbage- Broke on very first use! Do Not Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: VERY FIRST TIME of trying to use, directly out of the box.... BROKE! The hinge just came completely apart! Didn't do anything except try to grab the dog's "business" in our backyard. (Begrudgingly, since it was again, the VERY FIRST USE) tried to see if there was a way to possibly fix, but because of how its constructed, there's no way. Now it's useless.... Thankfully Amazon just refunded the item, so now I will definitely try a different brand/type. Maybe I got a dud??? Regardless, will look for something different. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: S. Proc

customer_reviews.title: A really solid, easy to use, very functional scooper
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in the pictures, this is ruggedly-made, and has a nice scoop with mild teeth on one side. After a few minutes, you'll be able to pick up the stuff in almost any situation -- wet or dry, on sand or grass, small or large. I wouldn't say it makes this particular chore fun, but almost semi-fun is a fair description.
customer_reviews.author: Teh Arbitrageur

customer_reviews.title: Wowzers! This is AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I have two labs...I scoop the poop everyday. This nifty product has saved me the wretching and gagging and dread of daily poo scooping. In the past I put on two sets of gloves,stuck my nose inside my shirt, and facing the dreaded task armed with plastic bags...I am thrilled with the fact that I need only gloves and my hose...I love my poochachaoes but not their poop! While I'm not all, "Yiss! Time to scoop up poop!" I'm also not dry heaving and crying involuntary tears from the watering of my eyes while holding my breath! Easy to use, completely effective and worth a lot more than $11.77!
customer_reviews.author: Sarahgc

customer_reviews.title: It beats using a plastic bag by a long shot
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy both walking my dogs and taking them to the park . I do not enjoy picking up dog poop with a flimsy plastic bag . So this scoop is what I needed . It scoops and that's about it . It made fairly well and quick blast with a garden hose gets it clean . I bought the "grass" one which has a saw tooth design on one of the jaws . It doesn't pull up the grass when scooping so no bare spots in the yard , if that matters to you .
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: It gives a great hand work out
customer_reviews.text: If you want to pick up your dogs poop without having to bend very far, then this is the pooper scooper for you. It picks up both our little dog poop and our big dog poop. It gives a great hand work out, I am confident my hand is getting stronger because of the squeeze. It isn't very long. I am 5'7" and find that I have to be a bit hunched to reach all the poop, but it beats bending down to the ground to pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Poopy Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: We live in an apartment complex and found that we were having to use SO MANY bags for our little Chiweenie. We use it without a bag with no problems. We just have to rinse it off every once and awhile to make sure that it doesn't get too stinky. We leave it outside and bought a small garbage can to put the poop in and throw it out about twice a week. I love that I don't have to put my hands anywhere near the poop.
customer_reviews.author: Thenewdarwin

customer_reviews.title: Easy return after it arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: My old broke when I accidentally dropped the shovel on it, so I just ordered a new one. I was disappointed when it came with the plastic joint broken. The company is sending replacement right away so very happy about that. I was very happy with my older one and it was sturdy and has a strong spring so it picks up even the ickyest of pools. I would have given 5 stars if it would not have come broken. I hope the quality has not gone down, but definitely giving it a second try and just hoping it was a fluke
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Repeat customer
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of the same as I was happy with the first. This is a mechanical device that will break eventually and I got 2+ years out of my last one. I'd say that's pretty decent for the price. I'm 6'1" so still have to bend down a bit to pick up the poop so if not using good squatting form can cause a little back strain that could be improved by a longer model otherwise I'm quite pleased with it. I recommending switching hands every so often as I did get some hand cramps when I procrastinated longer than I care to admit and had a LOT of poop to pick up.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Turns Out to be a Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical with such a low price, but it was recommended by a friend so I gave it a shot. I got an excellent buy! It seems to be made from quality material that will last (I’ve only had it a couple of weeks, so we will see if it lasts as long as I think it will). The “teeth” align perfectly, allowing me to grab the entire mess, not leaving any behind. I’m very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is OK
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed it wasn't as long as I thought it was. I measured before ordering but somehow it seemed shorter when it arrived. I'm 5'4" and still had to bend a little. It's sturdy plastic. I had the same type before and broke trying to pick up frozen waste . Won't pick up a very large dogs waste in one scoop (think Englis Mastiff) but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: L. Scheve

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use, better for dirt.
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the idea of this and was super excited but its really difficult to use and doesn't always work. I have to fight to get the handles to open and the claws won't grab the poop all the time, sometimes it ends up cutting the poop in half. I think this would be better for dirt. Disappointment becuase I really liked the idea and was super excited.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh Hamil

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: We have two German shepherds. So their poop tends to collect fast in our backyard. We needed an easy, fast way to clean up the mess with our busy schedule. It’s super easy to use, but it can get messy... which means you’ll have to get up close and personal with getting the mess out of the teeth part. Otherwise it gets the job done. Seems very sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Janine Barton

customer_reviews.title: Must have!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about this product. Build quality is good and they are easy to use. We have a bucket that I walk around with weekly. You need to let the stuff dry before using this tool. One they are dry, you can easily clean up your property with this tool. Our dog is free to run around our property. He typically goes in one of four places and it is easy to clean up. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: The Nelsons

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Important note: I have two dogs - a Boxer, AmStaff mix and a Shar Pei and Border Collie mix, and live in Minnesota, so if you don't pick up after your dog immediately, you're chiseling it out of ice... That said, this scooper works great. The only reason I've had to replace it is because I tried to chisel out some very frozen poop that was too frozen. This works great in the winter otherwise. It works really well in long and short grass and doesn't leave behind a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Leea

customer_reviews.title: Les than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed when this dog waste scoop arrived because it is essentially the same design as the product I have been using. Essentially neither do a good job in collecting waste in even moderately thick grass, although the Dogit model is slightly better in that it is clearly made of stronger plastic and has stiffer springs to clasp the jaws together. In that respect it is improved. Surely someone can come up with a better design.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Bookout

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: We thought we'd save a couple dollars and get this one and it lasted 4 days before the clamps broke. Maybe if you have one tiny little dog that poops on concrete but if you have grass/dirt/rocks ANYwhere in your yard this WILL BREAK! I'd send it back but it's got poop on it.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Works great.... even in snow...
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy to clean up my snowy yard with this quality device.... When working with frozen poop sickles, I just pry they loose with a yard scraper and scoop they up with my Dogit.... Great price for a great product!!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Works in Thick Grass
customer_reviews.text: The teeth on this scooper are a great size and gauge for picking up poop from the grass. The teeth are separated enough to go through the grass under the poop and grab it from underneath, which limits the mess. It's a little short for me, but in fairness, I'm taller than average.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Strong and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I do wish this was slightly longer, my 6’2” husband complains about having to slightly bend over to scoop the dog poop. I’m 5’6” and have zero issues. It’s fairly sturdy, because our dog is dumb and keeps pooping on the turf and not the grass, and this will twist and hold tight on the dried in poop and break it up and hold it while I drop it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear Bethay

customer_reviews.title: Way too much pressure!
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I wanted an alternative to the common green poop bags. When I first got this I was in shock at how cheap it felt.. none the less I tried it a couple of times and I can no longer use the scooper. The strength it takes to open is ridiculous and the closing is so strong it just rips my grass out. There is no happy middle for this one.
customer_reviews.author: MyLo

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Sturdy and Picks Up Well
customer_reviews.text: So, I have a miniature Maltese and was afraid the teeth on this scooper would be too open to actually pick up such a small amount of poo. It works great! Gets under and picks up. Not hard to squeeze the handle to open it and light weight also. Had another for double the price that had a rake and collector. This one works so much better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Darly

customer_reviews.title: It does it's dooty
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. Picks up the poop. Looks pretty solid and not too hard to grip. Hopefully will last longer than my last that broke when I accidentally hit it a tad hard trying to get some remenant excrement off.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the wide teeth so I'm not picking up all the gravel and getting stuck in the grass, it's much better quality than the $15 one we had at Walmart that broke, resulting in us buying this one. The springs are tight and its easy to squeeze even with my snow gloves on and it is big enough for my large puppies large doo doos
customer_reviews.author: Mookie

customer_reviews.title: You need this one!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's just a pooper scooper BUT we have 3 dogs and I can walk our entire acre and pick up everything before needing to go empty the scooper. I'm a fan of the teeth on it. There's a slight gap so you're able to pick up the dog poop and not rip up sections of grass. Costs a little more than others but IMO, totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brittanie DeAngelis

customer_reviews.title: Best Scooper
customer_reviews.text: We love this scooper. We have 3 dogs and often we foster, so ours get used a lot. We are not gentle with them and before we discovered this brand/model we went through one every three months or so. Since we bought this one, it lasted a year. We just boight a new one and it works great. The springs stay on & do not rust. The plastic is stong yet resiliant. We will continue to buy this brand/model.
customer_reviews.author: Sazqwatch

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product.
customer_reviews.text: I order the grass version. I like that is does not pull up the grass when you close the scooper. The only thing I can think of that would improve my experience would be that I am 6'1" and the product is a tad short so I have to bend over while cleaning up the yard. I would much rather bend at the waist instead of all the way down to the ground though!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be longer .
customer_reviews.text: It will not work on the watery runny gloppie stuff . It will not work on the HOT long wiggly piles...but will work GREAT on the solid crunchie already cooled off junk . Dogs must think folks are dummies....we get sooo happy with them when they poop....then we thank them and bag it as if it's a gift ! ; ]
customer_reviews.author: R A Murillo

customer_reviews.title: Plastic that breaks every year
customer_reviews.text: Over time, the plastic parts holding the jaws together get brittle and break. I would order one per year but feel bad about throwing the old one away. I ordered the 2 piece rake and scoop instead. It's not as easy to use but will last for many years. I would not but these again.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this scooper ZERO stars I would! This plastic is flimsy so the scoop will not fully open. Additionally, the scooper hinge hooks onto it, NOT fully built together, so the hinge continually slips off causing the scoop to either not close all the way (poop falls out and unable to pick it up) or the scoop doesn’t fully/evenly open so you can’t get the scoop around the pile of poop - again, not able to pick up the poop. This is very poorly designed and maybe I got what I paid for.. but don’t purchase this. It’s ineffective and a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Pretty crappy, crap picker-upper
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. The claws don't clamp together well enough to pick up the 💩. Takes lots of balancing and uneccesary work just to get it off the ground, let alone into the bag....and this is to simply pick the 💩 up off a flat surface area. Forget trying to use it to pick up anything effectively if it's laying in grass. This thing will break first
customer_reviews.author: Tara Mulvin

customer_reviews.title: mine broke
customer_reviews.text: The problems are plastic at the round connection of scoop the hole kept coming apart from where it connects, and upon second day the plastic broke as soon as I started picking up poop. Also the teeth are just way too big on one side so it doesnt function as good as my old ones on grass.
customer_reviews.author: SheKnocks

customer_reviews.title: Durable and strong, but gentle on your plants.
customer_reviews.text: Dog poops? This thing scoops! The springs on this are pretty strong - any stronger and I would worry about weak people not being able to open it. But that is a good thing, because it means the jaws close very well, even if you have thick grass. The fact that one side has teeth while the other doesn't means you can pick up even small or mushy pieces without pulling up your plants along with them. For the most part, poop has not stuck to this scooper. I also leave it outside in the sun every day, and so far no signs of degradation.
customer_reviews.author: M. Champ

customer_reviews.title: This makes pickup easy.
customer_reviews.text: I have used a shovel to scoop for so many years, it's embarrassing. This tool makes pickup so much easier, it's ridiculous NOT to have one. This really does great in picking up the piles without smearing everything across the grass. It picks things up cleanly and efficiently. In way less time the yard is picked up. This is simply a "must have" for dog owners who have a yard.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Taylor Seagull

customer_reviews.title: Stop bending down
customer_reviews.text: A perfect device for cleaning up after Fido does his thing. I've used this for a little while now and its holding up extremely well. Would recommend this to anyone that cleans up after their pet. It does have a tendency to accumulate a little dooky on it so store in a plastic bag if in your car or in my case it simply stays in the back of my truck when I take my dog to and from the park
customer_reviews.author: chessie

customer_reviews.title: BREAKS EASILY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: A small piece of the handle broke off immediately but figured “no big deal” since it still functioned just fine. The entire spring mechanism broke off completely yesterday while scooping up poop. Didn’t even make it two months. Good design but CHEAP plastic that breaks easily.
customer_reviews.author: MrM

customer_reviews.title: Best $5.60 pooper scooper ever
customer_reviews.text: It's a pooper scooper. It successfully scoops the poop. I needed a new one after the one I'd had for seven or eight years finally bit the dust. This one is the same size, but at half to 1/4 of the price. It feels solid enough. I'm 5'5" and didn't break my back or anything while using it. I do have to tilt at the hips to reach down, but I'm in good enough shape that I can handle some tilting. Can't be beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Boss

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim during Amazon Prime day, and I am totally satisfied with it. I can clean up my lawn in less than half the time it took me to clean it using other methods and it is soooo much easier on my back--no more bending over to pick the poop up. I am 5'5" and this scoop is just the right size for me. It works very well on our Bermuda grass. I had purchased a different brand several years ago and didn't like it at all--I find this one to be well made and it can pick up all the mess on the first attempt.
customer_reviews.author: V'Lora Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This makes it so much easier to clean up after my dogs. I have a bad back so this product has made cleaning the yard so much better since I don’t have to bend too much. The handle is a little short though. I would prefer if it was just a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart and broken within 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This thing is made of cheap plastic are cracked easily. It is also coming apart and does not close all the way. Save your money and use a shovel if you have one already or but something that is worth it. I saw one just like it at the. 99 cent store of I knew it would break in just a few months I would have rather bought one of those and only wasted a dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Lozolla

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: This item broke the first time I used it. It cracked at the hinge. Spring is too tight. If I could return it with poop on it, I would. The 10yo scooper I have in the garage that’s cracked with no more teeth left still works better than this scooper. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Scooters Dad

customer_reviews.title: Well built, sturdy, does the job
customer_reviews.text: This scoop seems to be better made that the two other brands I've owned of this design. It closes its' jaws with a good bit more force than the others. I expect that it will last a good long time. The only negative about it is the width of the jaw opening; the could open a bit more for those gifts from the bigger dogs.
customer_reviews.author: DogFlight

customer_reviews.title: no more bending over or feel the poop through the bag
customer_reviews.text: I know that was a little TMI, but I hate feeling the warm or cold poop through the doggy bag. Drives me crazy and makes me sick just thinking about it. I pick up my dogs poop once a week in the yard. she is a poopy machine who goes 3 times a day. this really eliminated the headaches. If you worry about poop cakes on the catcher. just wait for a day so it can dry out. I live in texas where is >100F everyday. good luck
customer_reviews.author: Sandy8

customer_reviews.title: Very delicate dog scooper
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave this product 3 stars cause of its durability. I observe this scooper lean on a wall outside and the wind blew it down shatter the scooper part, destroyed. What a piece of junk. Thought plastic would show some resiliency towards a little gust of wind.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should.  Only one issue
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. The only thing that makes it less than five stars is that you can’t extend it. My kids are both over 6 foot tall and it would be nice if they didn’t have to stoop over to use this product. Otherwise, it’s really great.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Henley

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a courtyard that my 4 dogs use for quick potty breaks that is mostly concrete. This scooper works so well and doesn't leave anything behind like other scoopers I have used. It has held up well so far and with four big dogs I have to scoop a lot. So glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good for all sizes of dog waste
customer_reviews.text: Way better than the previous scooper we got from WalMart. Very sturdy, picks up poo easily. Decent length handle so my back doesn’t hurt from bending so much and my much taller hubby agrees. Easily hoses off. I would recommend. I have a medium size dog so his piles aren’t really big, but I feel this would work well for large dogs also. Has a good size capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use scooper
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the overall strength and ease of use when purchasing this because some can be cheap and flimsy or hard to squeeze the handle. it is for my 10 year old to use when doing chores and he has physical limitations but so far it seems sturdy but easy to use and he’s had no trouble!
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use. Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this it broke. It is very cold where I live right now and all of the dog piles are frozen. On the second pile one side of the scooper cracked. It is still usable, but in no way should it have cracked that easily. Also it was not even left put in the cold. It was brand new sitting in the warm house so the plastic was not brittle from being outside.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, no more land mines
customer_reviews.text: So let’s start off with my dog is 160 lbs... The land mines in my back yard are shocking. This is land mine remover works perfectly. You should get one, it’s easy to hose off, and is long enough to keep you out of the danger zone.
customer_reviews.author: E.Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Works well but could be longer
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'6" and have to lean a bit to pick up waste with this. It would be nice if the handle was a few inches longer so it would be more convenient to use. This doesn't really make a huge difference when picking up one pile of waste, but it does make a difference when cleaning the entire back yard. Otherwise, it works well and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use and easy to clean, amazing idea by itself but this particular product broke after third time me using it. Not so sturdy I would say. My suggestion is be very careful when using it, it can break. I am still able to use it though.
customer_reviews.author: Viktoria Zimina

customer_reviews.title: Scooper Rocks!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This made my life easy. My front yard starts to become mine field after my Rottie poops 3 -5 times a day. Its just hard to shovel and pick them up. With this waste scooper it not only scoop the dog droppings but also the grass it has a strong grasp. This one rocks highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: babyface

customer_reviews.title: Pooper scooper
customer_reviews.text: Sorry guys, it broke after the second or third day. My toddlers were most likely messing with it but the plastic was not very strong. Also, this kind of pooper scooper seemed good with the one piece of equipment but if you have two dogs and two poops you end up making two trips instead of one! 3 stars because it did pick poop up and would have lasted a bit longer without kids but at the price range I’d probably have bought the metal one instead.
customer_reviews.author: haylie redd

customer_reviews.title: Good scooper but handle is too short
customer_reviews.text: We use this to scoop poop (obviously) and it has been great tool for us to have in our small yard. It’s easy to pick up droppings with this. I walk around with a plastic bag in one hand and this scooper and just toss the droppings into the bag. Afterwards, I’ll rinse the scooper off with the hose and any residue easily comes off. My only complaint is how short the scooper is. I’m already a short person and find it a bit tiring to be bending over to scoop up with the short handle.
customer_reviews.author: A.V.

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: ok when it worked, Maybe mine was defective but the plastic handle has already broken. Its December and I bought it in October. The original one that I had lasted for many years. I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: 9/10 at scooping poop
customer_reviews.text: This pooper scooper is very sturdy! It’s a little hard to squeeze the handle to open it, but I think I’ll get used to it. Teeth are great for scooping up poop, but it makes it a little hard to clean. I just stand about 3 feet back and hose the inside down with strong water pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Super Dooper Pooper Scooper
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I got the street model but it works just fine in my back yard. I had a summers worth of poo in my back yard and in 20 minutes, all that could be cleaned up was cleaned up. It is plastic but its also not 30 bucks. If you want a cheap pooper scooper, this one is for you! I bet Shaggy keeps one of these for Scooby.
customer_reviews.author: Rick J

customer_reviews.title: Seniors, children and ladies should be aware that the grip abd spring is somewhat difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars for price, n quality . Ergonomics was not great however. The spring that opens/shuts the grabber was way too tight. Handle grip was too big for avg hand. I could see ladies and children, as well as seniors having difficulty with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dre

customer_reviews.title: Small but effective
customer_reviews.text: The handle is a bit shorter than what I’m use to. I’m not that tall 5’5 but I still have to bend. Bending is not a problem, it’s just my other popper scoopers don’t require bending. But it’s a good sturdy product and it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This item is great at three dogs if you let the feces dry up it's super easy to pick up and doesn't stick to the claw works great on the grass concrete or dirt. My back doesn't hurt from using the shovel any longer
customer_reviews.author: Tara G.

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: The pooper scooper works really good, the main drawback is that it is pretty weak and not too sturdy, the first one broke in first day , they sent replacement and second one has held up fine maybe just a defective one
customer_reviews.author: JoserG

customer_reviews.title: Convenient but Tough to Clean
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s good to clean up poop. I wait a few days for the poop to harden more, otherwise is gets smushed all over the claws and smells awful. Not really sure how to clean this yet...I just keep it outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: A Simple solution for a  messy job!
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use and picks up quickly without a fuss - would highly recommend for anyone that has to pick up dog(or whatever animal) poop. Simple to operate and easily cleaned - so much better than using your hands wrapped in a bag to pick up waste.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S. Wolfson Sr.

customer_reviews.title: A bit short but price to quality ratio definitely a buy.
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality is not bad. For me its a little short causing the need to bend over more to us it. The spring seems sturdy and keeps the jaws tight. Not to bad of deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfstep

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time - Broke on first use.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Received the replacement and it came broken in the box. Now I need to take time out of my day to return it to a UPS store. Extremely dissapointed. Not worth my time or effort. Unfortunately, I got what I paid for and it either came broken or broke during its first use. I requested a new one to be delivered in its place and will report back if there is a better outcome.
customer_reviews.author: MJahn

customer_reviews.title: It works just as I'd hoped it would!
customer_reviews.text: Picks it up well and easily, whether fresh or old and dry, and leaves the ground relatively clean! Simple to use with just one hand (I guess I have to admit how much I talk on my cell phone while I poop scoop, but this was a real plus for me!) and very light yet plenty sturdy. Really glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen O. P.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy! Same as items 3x the price- takes care of BIG DOG business !
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Does exactly what it’s suposed to do and a great product for the price. I’ve seen the same quality item in a pet store for $30. Makes for easy yard clean up- we have a 132lb Rottweiler, so I can vouch that it can handle “big jobs”! (Not kidding, it’s like cleaning up after a small llama.) Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Diggs

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning up poop is now less poopy!
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to use. I have had this for a while and it still works very cleanly. Just a little bit of pressure is all you need to open the jaws and than release to trap the waste. Can only hold on load at a time obviously because you have to actually open it but it works amazing. Making cleaning up poop less poopy!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Im Happy
customer_reviews.text: Works great..... I took off one star simply because the spring to open the jaws is a little stiff. Not an issue if you pick up after your dogs regularly but your hand might get tired if you have a lot of pickup to do. Keep in mind that that comment is coming from a 70 year old lady who is not as strong as she once was.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Ike

customer_reviews.title: Works. Good quality. Short, hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Could be better. Soft poos stick to the 'claw.' it's a little short so if you have a bad back I wouldn't recommend. It's hard to pick up more than one dropping at a time. But it's doable. Probably wouldn't purchase again but it's not bad and it does what you need to for the most part.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: the Dogit Jawz seem to be sturdy, good springs and solid
customer_reviews.text: This comes in two pieces, which is my only criticism - it takes two people to put the two pieces together. Otherwise, the Dogit Jawz seem to be sturdy, good springs and solid. The work very well. They are a little shorter than the ones I'm replacing, but that said, they certainly don't take much bending to pick up our dog's leavings. I'd buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: T.L.Davis

customer_reviews.title: Scoops poop perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for dog poop! It's got a strong clamp which is great for scooping in grass. It's not super long, but long enough where your not bending to much. This is totally worth the price! The handle isn't to hard squeeze either.
customer_reviews.author: Star73

customer_reviews.title: Product is exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had no issues with it not doing what it’s advertised to do. Only reason I didn’t give a full 5 stars is because: 1. I wish the scoop was longer but that’s due to my height of 6’4” 2. A bigger scoop for those who have larger dogs (e.g. Rottie Shepherd) 3. Stronger “chomp” when releasing the handle
customer_reviews.author: Omar Kaif

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: I picked up one pile of poop, and when I went to pick up another, one of the claws came unhooked. After closer observation, I found that it was broken. The piece should be a solid round piece. Instead it was like a hook. Then I noticed that each side was different. The seller or manufacturer tried to add a piece to the broken side. So they, KNEW it was defective and instead of tossing it and sending a new one, they pathetically tried to fix it. Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Use it all the time
customer_reviews.text: We have used these before and wasn't sure I could find one. Happy I found on amazon. It's great but if you have arthritis in your hands it is hard to squeeze till you get use it several times to loosen up.
customer_reviews.author: jayhawk

customer_reviews.title: Broken before using it
customer_reviews.text: Upon arrival I was excited to start cleaning up the dog poo without using my hands in a plastic groceries bag. However...as soon as I opened the box there was already a broken part of the handle. I suggest not getting a plastic pooper scooper.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It's all plastic. You get what you pay for. I used it one time and the jaws pop off track. Making me have to adjust it after every pick up. Very frustrating
customer_reviews.author: Flea5711

product_meta.title: Dogit Jawz Dog Waste Scooper, Dog Pooper Scooper for Easy Pavement Pick Up, D128
product_meta.description: The Dogit Clean Jawz Waste Pet Pooper Scooper for Concrete and Smooth Surfaces ergonomic handle features a soft, contoured rubber pad for your fingers, providing a comfortable grip. The dog scoop has two calibrated springs for safe, durable, and reliable operation. The unit is 25.5 inches in length, which provides excellent reach and helps eliminate bending. The dog pooper scooper is made of strong yet lightweight plastic that can be rinsed easily after use. This scooper is specially designed for picking up waste on concrete and smooth surfaces in one easy motion. This product is the perfect maintenance tool for puppies, small dogs, medium dogs, large dogs, and extra-large dog breeds. Dogit has a complete line of pet supplies including dog bowls, dog beds, dog toys, dog collars, dog leashes, dog food, dog treats, dog poop bags, dog crates, dog gates, dog poop rakes, dog harnesses and more!
feature_bullets: Practical, easy to use and very convenient dog poop scooper
Features smaller spikes ideal for scooping dog waste from concrete and flat surfaces, and the ergonomically designed handle provides comfortable one-handed operation
Lightweight design is perfect for dog walks, cleaning up your backyard, or when traveling
Spring loaded pooper scooper enables quick and easy waste collection in one simple motion
Provides excellent reach and helps eliminate bending. DIMENSIONS: 6in L x 5.3 in W x 25 in H (15.24 cm x 13.46 cm x 63.5 cm).

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
